thread.title: Kardashian-Jenners release statement on Lamar Odom
thread.title_full: Kardashian-Jenners release statement on Lamar Odom

title: Kardashian-Jenners release statement on Lamar Odom
text:
Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner, Lamar Odom, Khloe Kardashian and Kourtney Kardashian at the Teen Choice Awards in 2010. (Photo: Chris Pizzello, AP)
72 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN 26 COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Kardashian-Jenner clan are halting all publishing on their apps in support of Lamar Odom.
In the first joint statement from the sisters, Lamar's estranged wife Khloé Kardashian joined Kim Kardashian, Kendall Jenner and Kylie Jenner in releasing an identical statement on their websites Thursday night.
USA TODAY
Kardashians leave hospital as Lamar Odom remains in coma
The Kardashian-Jenners' statement. (Photo: Khloewithak.com)
The former NBA player was rushed to a medical facility after being found unresponsive by staff at a brothel known as the Love Ranch in Crystal, Nev. on Tuesday.
"As a family, we've decided to hold of on publishing content across our apps while we continue to support and pray for Lamar," it reads. "Thank you for your kindness and understanding during this difficult time."
On Thursday, Khloé reportedly remained at the bedside of Odom as other members of the Kardashian family visited and left, with speculation growing that his life-threatening condition was worsening.
USA TODAY
Lamar Odom used cocaine, up to 10 sexual performance supplements before hospitalization
According to a 911 call released Wednesday by the Nye County Sheriff’s Department, Odom took cocaine and as many as 10 sexual-performance supplement pills leading up to his hospitalization in Las Vegas.
Several other members of the Kardashian-Jenner family, including Kris and Kendall Jenner, have posted about the tragic situation on social media.
USA TODAY
Rob Kardashian and Kris Jenner post heartbreaking messages for Lamar Odom
Lamar Odom and then-wife Khloe Kardashian arrive at the Philippe Restaurant West Hollywood grand opening in Oct. 2009. Jason Merritt, Getty Images Fullscreen From left, Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner, Lamar Odom, Khloe Kardashian and Kourtney Kardashian at the Teen Choice Awards in Aug. 2010. Chris Pizzello, AP Fullscreen Lamar Jr., Lamar Odom, daughter Destiny, Khloe Kardashian, Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner and Kourtney Kardashian at the 2011 Teen Choice Awards held at the Gibson Amphitheatre in Aug. 2011. Jason Merritt, Getty Images Fullscreen Khloe Kardashian called hubby Lamar Odom her "Lammy." But sadly, the union didn't last. Evan Agostini, AP Fullscreen A photo from Season 12 of 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians,' the family's hit E! show. From left: Kendall Jenner, Rob Kardashian, Scott Disick, Kourtney Kardashian, Lamar Odom, Khloe Kardashian Odom, Kim Kardashian, Bruce Jenner, Kris Jenner and Kylie Jenner. E! Entertainment Fullscreen Khloe and Lamar Odom seemed so happy for so long. Here they are in 2010 at an event in Hollywood. Jason LaVeris, FilmMagic Fullscreen Lamar Odom and Khloe Kardashian on June 7, 2012, in Orange, Calif. Jason LaVeris, FilmMagic Fullscreen Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom and his wife, Khloe Kardashian, pose with his trophy as the winner of the 2010-2011 NBA Sixth Man Award, as the basketball league's top reserve, at a news conference in Los Angeles on April 19, 2011. Reed Saxon, AP Fullscreen Khloe Kardasian and Lamar Odom debut their unisex fragrance Unbreakable at Perfumania in Orlando, Fla., on Feb. 12, 2011. Roberto Gonzalez, AP Fullscreen Khloe Kardashian and Lamar Odom, of the Dallas Mavericks, sit rinkside as they take in an NHL hockey game between the Chicago Blackhawks and the Dallas Stars on March 16, 2012, in Dallas.
